channels.name: LinkedIn - Canadian CS Students with AI Startups
channels.description: Computer science students in Canada who have founded AI startups or are working on AI projects
channels.searchQuery: site:linkedin.com/in computer science student Canada AI founder startup

example.name: Anas Khan
example.description: 4th year CS student at University of Toronto, Founder @ Learning Mode AI (AI-powered learning platform), has GitHub (AnasKhan0607) with microservices, K3s cluster, and AI projects using GPT-4 API. Portfolio: anaskhan.ca

channels.reason: Direct access to CS students who have shipped AI products and have public GitHub portfolios demonstrating technical ability

channels.name: LinkedIn - Canadian CS Students with AI/ML Experience
channels.description: CS students at Canadian universities with hands-on AI/ML work experience and technical projects
channels.searchQuery: site:linkedin.com/in computer science student Canada AI machine learning projects

example.name: Ali Khan
example.description: CS student at York University, AI Researcher @ AI Club, worked as ML Engineer at Exponentia.ai building RAG chatbots using Python, ChromaDB, Sentence Transformers, and Chainlit with Google Gemini Pro LLM

channels.reason: Students with proven AI/ML work experience and specific technical skills in modern LLM stack

channels.name: LinkedIn - US CS Students Seeking AI/ML Opportunities
channels.description: Computer science students at US universities actively seeking AI/ML roles with GitHub portfolios
channels.searchQuery: site:linkedin.com/in computer science student USA AI machine learning seeking opportunities GitHub

example.name: Surya Harshith
example.description: CS & Bioinformatics student at California State University Fresno (2026), experience in ML (healthcare predictive models, Python/Scikit-learn), C++, Java, JavaScript. GitHub: github.com/SuryaGona. Actively seeking software engineering or AI/ML opportunities

channels.reason: Students explicitly seeking opportunities with relevant ML project experience and active GitHub profiles

channels.name: LinkedIn - Canadian CS Students with AI Agent Projects
channels.description: CS students in Canada working on AI agents, RAG systems, and scalable AI tools
channels.searchQuery: site:linkedin.com/in computer science student Canada AI agent RAG

example.name: Abakar Kosso
example.description: CS student at Brock University, Software Engineering Intern building scalable AI systems and tools, worked on AI projects involving retrieval-augmented generation and agent workflows

channels.reason: Students working specifically on modern AI agent architectures and RAG systems relevant to the project

channels.name: GitHub - Awesome LLM Apps Repository Contributors
channels.description: Contributors and stargazers of popular open-source LLM application repositories

example.name: Shubham Saboo (Repository Creator)
example.description: Creator of awesome-llm-apps (68k stars, 8.5k forks) - collection of LLM apps with AI Agents, RAG, multi-agent teams using OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini. Active in LLM development community

channels.reason: Repository has 68k+ engaged developers interested in LLM apps; contributors likely have relevant skills though need to filter for students in USA/Canada

channels.name: DEV Community - CS Students with AI Portfolio Projects
channels.description: Computer science students writing about their AI/LLM projects and portfolios on DEV.to
channels.searchQuery: site:dev.to computer science student AI portfolio LLM projects

example.name: Aniruddha Adak (based on article)
example.description: CS student who wrote 'Building a Dynamic AI-Powered Portfolio: My Journey as a Computer Science Student' - demonstrates interest in AI and building projects publicly

channels.reason: Students who write about their AI projects publicly demonstrate strong interest and communication skills, though need to verify location and GitHub

channels.name: Y Combinator Jobs - Remote AI/ML Intern Positions
channels.description: YC startup job board filtered for remote AI/ML internships and part-time positions that attract CS students

example.name: AfterQuery (W25) - Software Engineer Intern
example.description: YC W25 research lab investigating AI capabilities hiring Software Engineer Interns. Platform attracts CS students interested in AI/startups. Can reverse-search applicants and engage with qualified candidates

channels.reason: Indirect channel - can identify students applying to similar AI internships, though requires more effort to source candidates

channels.name: Hacker News Who is Hiring - Remote AI Roles
channels.description: Monthly HN hiring threads filtered for remote AI/ML positions that CS students monitor

example.name: Learnwise.ai (via Nov 2025 thread)
example.description: Junior-Mid AI/ML/Backend Engineer role (2-4.5k EUR/month, remote EU timezone) building LLM-based conversational assistant in Edtech. HN threads attract CS students seeking remote work

channels.reason: Many CS students actively read HN hiring threads for remote opportunities, though need to filter for students vs experienced engineers
